author: leruaa
content: Hello, I wonder what is the most efficient way to compute the elligible/voted ether for a given epoch using beacon APIs ? I was looking at the beaconcha.in source code and it's using `/eth/v1alpha1/validators/participation`, but it's deprecated, right?

author: protolambda
content:
<@!230439127164780546> For Prysm specific APIs you should ask in the Prysm discord. The standard APIs (supported by all other clients, and soon Prysm) are documented here: https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/
What you can do is query `/eth/v1/beacon/states/{state_id}/validators` (with status filter), to get validators (and filter by slashed/not-slashed, active or not, etc.), then sum their effective balances. To get participant numbers I'm afraid the standard API doesn't offer what you want. The lighthouse API has some good API methods for this kind of thing though: https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/validator-inclusion.html

author: leruaa
content: Thanks a lot, I'm using Lighthouse, but I missed these APIs
